item.description:
We will do a 4.0  mile hike doing an outer loop on some of the Audubon trails around Battery Point.

Here is a link to 2 trial maps of Battery Point:

http://www.nhmountainhiking.com/hike/massabesic/map_big.jpg

http://www.nhaudubon.org/wp-content/uploads/brochures/MACMapColor.pdf

Here is a link to the Massabesic Audubon Center:

http://www.nhaudubon.org/locations/centers/massabesic

With the temperature up in the 40's when I checked some of the trails out on 3-3-12 the snow near the ground was slushy in places.  Waterproof footwear could be a must on the hike as  the temperature high for 3-4-12 is predicted to be around 42 degrees. If the temps get up to that high during the hike shoes that are not waterproof could get wet and soak through very quickly.   Also the snow is deep enough if anyone wanted to wear snowshoes and help trample a path for the others.  It's about 4 inches or so, so the trails can still be walked without wearing any snowshoes.
item.how_to_find_us: Due to the number of people going park straight back from the entrance to the parking lot towards the rear of the lot. The lot is opposite from the Audubon Center. This will give us a chance to spread out. We will start the hike from there.

group.name: Human Soles & Doggie Paws Hikers & Walkers of Manchester, NH

item.name: Battery Point Hiking Trails - Lake Massabesic - Audubon Center
